name: Present Deceptive Information
description: Present deceptive information about systems, data, processes, and users. Monitor uses or search for presence of that information.

name: Maintain Deception Environment
description: Maintain a distinct subsystem or a set of components specifically designed to be the target of malicious attacks for detecting, deflecting, and analyzing such attacks.

name: Detonation Chamber
description: Use a dynamic execution environment to handle potentially harmful incoming data.

name: Passive Decoys
description: Use a factitious system or resource to decoy adversary attacks away from operational resources, to increase the adversary's workload, or to observe adversary activities.

name: Component Provenance Validation
description: Validate the provenance of system components.

name: Supply Chain Diversity
description: Provide multiple distinct supply chains for system components.

name: Adversarial Simulation
description: Simulate adversary activities to test the effectiveness of system protections and detection mechanisms.

name: Dynamically Restrict Traffic or Isolate Resources
description: Dynamically reconfigure networks to restrict network traffic or isolate resources.

name: Virtual Sandbox
description: Use virtualization to create a controlled execution environment, which is expunged after execution terminates.

name: Application- or Utility-Specific Data Removal
description: Analyze files and data structures specific to an application or utility for anomalies, and delete them.

name: Execution Restriction
description: Restrict the sources of executables and the locations in which execution can occur, or implement other constraints on execution access.

name: Covert Signaling
description: Use hidden logic to enable exfiltrated data to signal its location or embed hidden data that can be the subject of a search.

name: Present Decoy Data
description: Present plausible but factitious data assets to attract the adversary. Monitor uses of those assets, or search for the presence of decoy information.

name: Fragment Information
description: Fragment information, and distribute it across multiple locations.

name: Lock Down Thin Nodes
description: Minimize local functionality, and disallow writable storage.

name: Dynamic Data Location
description: Dynamically move data resources.

name: Dynamic Account Management
description: Dynamically update an account's authorizations or privileges.

name: Partition Host
description: Partition a host (e.g., server, endpoint system) into separate logical domains.

name: Minimize Local Functionality
description: Construct or configure systems or applications to minimize their inherent functionality.

name: Trusted Path
description: Provide an isolated communications path between the user and security functions.

name: Dynamically Disable or Suspend
description: Terminate processes or disable capabilities upon triggering conditions.

name: Perform Mission Damage Assessment
description: Determine the mission consequences of adversary activities (e.g., which resources can be relied on; how quickly, how completely, and with what confidence mission-essential services, data, and communications can be restored from backups or alternative resources).

name: Active Decoys
description: Use one or more factitious systems or other resources to identify malicious sites, interact with the adversary, actively probe for malicious code, and observe adversary TTPs.

name: Minimize Data Retention or Lifespan
description: Minimize the lifespan or retention of data, and ensure that deleted data cannot be retrieved.

name: Authenticate Devices
description: Authenticate a device before establishing a connection to it.

name: Enhanced Authentication
description: Use situation-specific, risk- adaptive, or out-of-band authentication.

name: Minimize Duration of Connection or Session
description: Minimize the time period for which a connection remains open or a session remains active, requiring reauthorization to reestablish connectivity.

name: Design Diversity
description: Use multiple designs to implement the same functionality.

name: Check Policy Consistency
description: Ensure that policies are applied consistently across systems, applications, and services.

name: Validate Data Quality
description: Validate data quality (e.g., integrity, consistency, correctness).

name: Active Deception
description: Maintain an internal deception environment, divert suspicious traffic to that environment, and interact with and analyze behavior to determine whether it is malicious and whether to investigate adversary TTPs.

name: Quarantine or Delete Suspicious Files
description: Move and make inaccessible or delete suspicious files.

name: Isolate or Contain Selected Applications or Components
description: Isolate or contain (e.g., using internal firewalls or virtual environments) selected applications or components based on risk profiles.

name: Refresh Selected Applications or Components
description: Refresh software, firmware, or data from a trusted source.

name: Hide Sensitive Information
description: Conceal (e.g., via encryption or data hiding) or remove sensitive information (including metadata).

name: Identify External Malware
description: Identify and redirect malware found on external systems.

name: Validate Data Properties
description: Validate data properties (including binaries, metadata, and cryptographic bindings) to defend against modification or fabrication.

name: Switch to Alternative Data Sources
description: Switch to one or more alternative data sources to ensure adequate data quality or rebuild destroyed data.

name: Dynamically Reprovision
description: Reconfigure or reallocate resources to route around damage.

name: Use Alternate Communications
description: Use alternative communications paths.

name: Reconstruct Compromised Assets
description: Reconstruct assets (e.g., files, software components) that have been damaged, destroyed, or modified in a way that makes them suspect.

name: Switch to Protected Hot Shadow
description: Switch (failover) to a duplicate system in a protected enclave that, subject to additional quality controls on data and software updates, mirrors the system that has been compromised.

name: Switch to Alternate System or Component
description: Switch (failover) to another system or system component that provides approximately the same functionality in a different way.

name: Activate Alternate
description: Activate an alternate system or system component (e.g., from a war-time reserve) that provides approximately the same function in a novel or specialized way, and failover.

name: Defend Failover and Recovery
description: Increase sensor activity and restrict privileges to defend against an adversary taking advantage of failover or recovery activities.

name: Refresh Sessions or Connections
description: Terminate and re-establish sessions or network connections unpredictably to disrupt adversary use.

name: Defend Against DoS
description: Adapt to reduce the impacts of denial-of-service attacks.

name: Conceal or Randomize Network Traffic
description: Conceal (via encryption or insertion of fabricated traffic) or randomize network traffic patterns.

name: Lock Down Visibility or Access
description: Restrict the visibility of or access to data based on the nature or attributes of that data.

name: Dynamically Relocate and Refresh Processing
description: Suspend a process and re- instantiate it in a different location.

name: Defend Enclave Boundaries
description: Maintain distinct enclaves based on security characteristics, and use stringent filtering to defend the enclave boundary.

name: Defend Against Memory Attacks
description: Provide defenses against attacks against system memory.

name: Modulate Information Flows
description: Use controlled interfaces and communication paths to provide access to risky capabilities or filter communications between enclaves.

name: Hardware-Based Protection of Firmware
description: Use hardware-based protections for firmware.

name: Validate Output Data
description: Validate information output from processes or applications against defined criteria.

name: Physically Relocate Resources
description: Physically move resources (e.g., storage devices, servers, end-user devices) with concomitant changes to network location.

name: Defend Against Data Mining
description: Enforce access restrictions, and provide alerting to defend against data mining.

name: Defend Audit Data
description: Provide mechanisms to protect audit data from modification or observation.

name: Enhance User Preparedness
description: Keep users, administrators, and operators aware of existing and emerging threats and attack techniques that they can counter in practice.

name: Conceal Resources from Discovery
description: Protect the network addresses of system components that are part of managed interfaces from discovery through common tools and techniques, such as hiding or relocation.

name: Collaborate to Counter Adversaries
description: Collaborate with other entities to counter adversary activities.

name: Restrict Supply Chain Exposures
description: Limit an adversary's ability to determine or manipulate the organization's cyber supply chain.

name: Calibrate Administrative Access
description: Configure administrator access to resources based on active defense strategies.

name: Enhance via Heterogeneity
description: Increase barriers to adversary effectiveness by providing architecturally diverse system components.

name: Inspect and Analyze Network Traffic
description: Analyze network traffic for unusual data flows. Traffic inspection and analysis can be performed at the enterprise boundary, at internal boundaries between enclaves, or within enclaves.

name: Endpoint Behavior Analysis
description: Analyze the behavior of endpoint (i.e., end-user, client) systems for anomalous behavior.

name: Monitor Logs
description: Monitor system and application logs for anomalous or suspicious behavior.

name: Analyze Logs
description: Analyze logs (individually or with some correlation across logs) for anomalous or suspicious patterns of behavior.

name: Analyze File Contents
description: Analyze the contents of specific files or types of files for suspicious contents.

name: Host Event Detection
description: Detect anomalous or unauthorized events on hosts (e.g., servers, endpoint systems).

name: Removable Device Usage Detection
description: Detect anomalous or unauthorized events involving the use of removable devices.

name: Software Integrity Check
description: Perform integrity checks (e.g., using checksums, hashes, or digital signatures) on software, software certificates, or metadata.

name: Software Stress Testing
description: Perform software stress testing (e.g., using out-of-bounds input values) prior to installation.

name: Physical Inspection
description: Perform a physical inspection of hardware components for indicators of tampering.

name: Monitor Trusted Parties
description: Monitor the behavior and status (e.g., change in ownership) of second or third parties.

name: Cross-Enterprise Account Usage Analysis
description: Analyze user account usage across the enterprise for anomalies or suspicious behavior.

name: Process Analysis
description: Analyze process attributes or behavior for indications of unusual, unauthorized, or suspicious use.

name: Process Monitoring
description: Monitor the behavior of processes for indications of unusual, unauthorized, or suspicious use.

name: Cloud Account Monitoring
description: Monitor activity associated with cloud accounts for indications of unusual, unauthorized, or suspicious use.

name: Privileged Account Monitoring
description: Monitor and analyze activity associated with privileged accounts for indications of unusual or suspicious use.

name: Cross-Enterprise Behavior Analysis
description: Correlate and analyze the behavior of multiple systems.

name: Endpoint Scrutiny
description: Scrutinize the contents and behavior patterns of an endpoint system.

name: Application- or Utility-Specific Monitoring
description: Monitor and analyze events in the context of a specific application or utility.

name: Account Monitoring
description: Monitor and analyze activity associated with user accounts for indications of unusual or suspicious use.

name: Host-Local Event Correlation
description: Correlate and analyze events occurring on a single host.

name: Centralize and Analyze Instance Logging
description: Centralize instance logging in a cloud or container environment and analyze.

name: Monitor Script Execution
description: Monitor for the execution of scripts that are unknown or used in suspicious ways.

name: Monitor the File System
description: Monitor the file system to identify the unexpected presence and atypical use of specific types of files or atypical patterns of access.

name: Monitor Specific Servers
description: Monitor specific servers for anomalous or suspicious uses or access attempts.

name: Monitor Specific Files
description: Monitor the use of specific files or directories for anomalous or suspicious uses or access attempts.

name: Monitor Command Line Use
description: Monitor command line interface use for common utilities (part of the system or installed by an adversary) and suspicious behavior.

name: Monitor Use of Libraries and Utilities
description: Monitor the use of libraries and utilities that are commonly used to support adversary actions.

name: Analyze Network Traffic Content
description: Analyze the contents of network traffic.

name: Analyze Outgoing Traffic Patterns
description: Analyze outgoing traffic for patterns of behavior that indicate adversary communications.

name: Monitor External Sources
description: Monitor and analyze external information sources for indicators of adversary activities, especially those targeting the organization.

name: Monitor Platform Status
description: Monitor the status of platforms (e.g., user endpoints, servers, network devices).

name: Monitor Network Usage
description: Monitor network usage for anomalous behavior.

name: Hunt for Malicious Processes
description: Hunt for applications or processes that display specific malicious or suspect behaviors.
